positive_comments: I like the organization and the real world examples.  Good combination of the various learning styles.  Nothing is too long so easy to fit in and keep attention.
improvement_opportunities: I think some exercises (other than discussion) earlier in the course might be useful.  Maybe something like giving a situation and asking some questions - for example 'Your team is designing a learning toy for 3-4 year olds' and asking things like who they'd want to work with, how they'd approach the discovery phase, etc.  Nothing too big, something well broken down, but a chance to actually play with a situation.

positive_comments: I really like the disparate sources and modalities.  Lots of good information in bite-size pieces
improvement_opportunities: It would be nice if the various charts/slides used in the videos would be made available.  They're not always easy to see in the smaller format and they're valuable information.  I know that some of them show up later, but maybe as part of the video module.
